doc: This interface only serves to hide the S/MIME implementation behind an easy-to-load-with-reflection class.

methods.name: decryptAttachments
methods.doc: @return The results of the S/MIME decryption of any compatible encrypted / signed attachments.

methods.name: decryptAttachments
methods.doc: @return The results of the S/MIME decryption of any compatible encrypted / signed attachments.

methods.name: decryptAttachments
methods.doc: @return A copy of given original 'true' attachments, with S/MIME encrypted / signed attachments replaced with the actual attachment.

methods.name: isSmimeAttachment
methods.doc: @return Whether the given attachment is S/MIME signed / encrypted. Defers to {@code SmimeRecognitionUtil.isSmimeAttachment(..)}.

methods.name: getSmimeDetails
getSignedByAddress
methods.doc:
Delegates to {@link #getSignedByAddress(MimePart)}, where the datasource of the attachment is read completely as a MimeMessage.
Note: the attachment is assumed to be a signed / encrypted {@link javax.mail.internet.MimeBodyPart}.

methods.name: getSignedByAddress
methods.doc: @return Who S/MIME signed /encrypted the attachment. This is indicated by the subject of the certificate (whom the certificate was 'issued to').
